subject: RE: [junit] Running remote tests
msgSnippet: You can do this with the Ant Junit task, specify the fork attribute. ... From: chelck@ebsdr.com [mailto:chelck@ebsdr.com] Sent: 06 September 2001 21:26 To:
messageBody:
You can do this with the Ant Junit task, specify the fork attribute.

-----Original Message-----
From: chelck@... [mailto:chelck@...]
Sent: 06 September 2001 21:26
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Running remote tests


I'm trying to extend JUnit to support Acceptence testing and I need to
run
each test (including setUp() and tearDown()) in its own JVM. Has anyone
done
this?
